title: How to Use Afterpay to Pay In-Store + Quick Fixes

steps.title: Download the Afterpay app.
steps.content: Download the Afterpay app. Afterpay is available is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Create an account.
steps.content: Create an account. If you don't already have an account, you'll need to make one. This is how you'll manage your payments and transactions. You may need to verify your account with a phone number.

steps.title: Set up the Afterpay Card.
steps.content: Set up the Afterpay Card. This needs to be done in the Afterpay app. [2] X Research source Open the Afterpay app. Tap In-Store . Tap Pay in store . Tap Setup the card . Follow the on-screen instructions.

steps.title: Add the Afterpay Card to your digital wallet.
steps.content: Add the Afterpay Card to your digital wallet. You can do this within the Afterpay app. Do the following: Tap Card . Tap Add to wallet . Enter the verification code if necessary. Tap Next . The card will be added to Apple Wallet or Google Wallet .

steps.title: Use your digital wallet to pay in-store.
steps.content: Use your digital wallet to pay in-store. When you're at the check-out lanes, you'll need to open your digital wallet app to pay. This will be Apple Pay (iOS) or Google Pay (Android). Follow the prompt on the card reader to use your digital wallet. Keep in mind you must have 25% of the purchase price available in your account balance for the transaction to be approved.

steps.title: Pay your balance.
steps.content: Pay your balance. To avoid extra charges, make sure to pay on time. You can find and pay your balance within the Afterpay app.

steps.title: Make sure your device supports digital wallet.
steps.content: Make sure your device supports digital wallet. If you have an older device or software version, you may not have the capability to add cards.

steps.title: Check if the store accepts Afterpay.
steps.content: Check if the store accepts Afterpay. You may be trying to pay a retailer that doesn't take Afterpay. To see which stores near you accept Afterpay, visit the Afterpay website .

steps.title: Verify your account.
steps.content: Verify your account. You may need to provide your phone number, card details, or other information to verify your identity. Additionally, if your payment methods have not been verified, your transactions may decline.

steps.title: Ask the cashier to ring up your card as a debit card.
steps.content: Ask the cashier to ring up your card as a debit card. If you're being asked for a PIN or CVV, the cashier most likely selected the "credit card" payment option. To fix this, retry the transaction as a "debit card". [3] X Research source

steps.title: Wait for your eligibility to change.
steps.content: Wait for your eligibility to change. If you can't use your Afterpay Card in-store, you may need to wait until you establish a payment history with Afterpay. You can do this by using Afterpay with other retailers online.
